Package org.ontal.imgutil.scaling

Class ImageScaler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ontal.imgutil.scaling.ImageScaler
  • public class ImageScaler
extends Object
    This utility offers quick image scaling transformations based on initial parameters and selected via method transformation type.

    There are several scaling transofmations available: Fit, Expand, Adjust, Expand, Limit and Tile.

    After the transformation is done, user can call any of the available for convience methods to obtain/save the resulting image.

    Usage example: 
     // get scaled BufferedImage
 new ImageScaler(Paths.get("/tmp/originalImage.jpg"))
         .adjust(200, 200)
         .getImage();

 // save scaled image into local file system
 new ImageScaler(Paths.get("/tmp/originalImage.jpg"))
         .fit(200, 200, new int[] { 192, 205, 224 })
         .saveAs(ImageFormat.JPG, Paths.get("/tmp"), "scaledImage");
    Since:
    May 2012
    Author:
    akaine

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      ImageScaler adjust​(int width, int height)
      Scales image to the max target dimension while maintaining its original ratio.
      ImageScaler expand​(int width, int height)
      Scales image to the target dimensions.
      ImageScaler fit​(int width, int height)
      Scales image fitting and centering it onto the output canvas with its original ratio conserved leaving unocupied canvas space filled with the default background color (white).
      ImageScaler fit​(int width, int height, int[] rgb)
      Scales image fitting and centering it onto the output canvas with its original ratio conserved leaving unocupied canvas space filled with the background color specified via the rgb argument.
      BufferedImage getImage()
      Obtains the produced image.
      ImageScaler limit​(Dimension dimension, int size)
      Scales image fitting it within the limit defined in pixels along the specified dimension.
      void saveAs​(ImageFormat imageFormat, Path outputDirectoryPath, String name)
      Saves the prodiced image in local file system using the provided output directory path and name.
      ImageScaler tile​(int width, int height)
      Uses input image as a tile filling the output image with the original image copies as they fit.
      byte[] toByteArray​(ImageFormat imageFormat)
      Converts the produced image into a byte array.

    • Method Detail

      • fit

        public ImageScaler fit​(int width,
                       int height)
        Scales image fitting and centering it onto the output canvas with its original ratio conserved leaving unocupied canvas space filled with the default background color (white). This can be particularly useful when the user needs to standardize the output dimmensions and at the same time maintain the original image uncut.
        Parameters:
        width - output width in pixels
        height - output height in pixels
        Returns:
        scaled image

      • fit

        public ImageScaler fit​(int width,
                       int height,
                       int[] rgb)
        Scales image fitting and centering it onto the output canvas with its original ratio conserved leaving unocupied canvas space filled with the background color specified via the rgb argument. This can be particularly useful when the user needs to standardize the output dimmensions and at the same time maintain the original image uncut.
        Parameters:
        width - output width in pixels
        height - output height in pixels
        rgb - excess area background color
        Returns:
        scaled image

      • expand

        public ImageScaler expand​(int width,
                          int height)
        Scales image to the target dimensions. When target ratio is different from the original one an image distortion may occur. Useful when the user just needs to scale the image without maintaining its ratio.
        Parameters:
        width - output width in pixels
        height - output height in pixels
        Returns:
        scaled image

      • adjust

        public ImageScaler adjust​(int width,
                          int height)
        Scales image to the max target dimension while maintaining its original ratio. In case output ratio is different from the original one the image is centered and cropped. Useful when the user needs to standardize the output dimmensions without having monotone borders.
        Parameters:
        width - output width in pixels
        height - output height in pixels
        Returns:
        scaled image

      • limit

        public ImageScaler limit​(Dimension dimension,
                         int size)
        Scales image fitting it within the limit defined in pixels along the specified dimension. Useful for setting a dimmensional limit for images without loosing their ratio.
        Parameters:
        dimension - limit dimension
        size - dimension size in pixels
        Returns:
        scaled image

      • tile

        public ImageScaler tile​(int width,
                        int height)
        Uses input image as a tile filling the output image with the original image copies as they fit. Isn't particularly useful but what the hell =).
        Parameters:
        width - output width in pixels
        height - output height in pixels
        Returns:
        tiled image

      • toByteArray

        public byte[] toByteArray​(ImageFormat imageFormat)
                   throws IOException
        Converts the produced image into a byte array.
        Parameters:
        imageFormat - image format
        Returns:
        image bytes
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs while writing

      • saveAs

        public void saveAs​(ImageFormat imageFormat,
                   Path outputDirectoryPath,
                   String name)
            throws IOException
        Saves the prodiced image in local file system using the provided output directory path and name.
        Parameters:
        imageFormat - image format
        outputDirectoryPath - output directory path
        name - image file name without extension
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs while writing
